III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Program Statement
Title
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12502
Section (1) An agency shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement that includes all the following information: (b) Eligibility
requirements for a youth, including age and level of physical,
emotional, and intellectual functioning and youth not appropriate
for the program.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation The agency failed to locate a proper placement for youth after
AWOL.
Investigation On 4/9/25 Complainant reported Youth A, a refugee minor, was
living with friends of her brother after running away from Bethany
Christian Services (BCS). The friends asked Youth A to leave.
Youth A did not have any local family and did not know where to
go. BCS failed to find a new placement for Youth A, leaving Youth
A at risk of being homeless. Contact occurred with complainant on
4/9/25. No additional information was reported.
Interviews:
Chief Administrator was contacted via email on 4/9/25. Chief
Administrator stated Program Director had the needed information
and should be the contact person for the investigation.
Program Director was contacted via email on 4/9/25. Program
Director (PD) reported he was in contact with MDHHS Worker
regarding the investigation. A phone interview occurred with PD
on 4/29/25. PD reported Youth A went AWOL in January 2024.
The agency’s federal contract with the Office of Refugee
Resettlement (ORR) requires cases to be closed within 48 hours
of unapproved absence. Bethany closed the case in January
2024. DCWL requested documentation of Youth A’s discharge
from the program. PD stated he did not believe they had a
completed discharge summary. PD stated when Youth A
contacted the agency in April 2025 to find a placement, the
agency could not place her as the case had been closed. PD
reported he believed the case responsibility was in the hands of
the local MDHHS. PD stated there was a court order when Youth
A became a temporary court ward in 2023, which stated she was
under the care of MDHHS. PD admitted there was some
confusion, as the court seemed to believe Youth A was the
2

responsibility of Bethany, despite the court order and the case
being closed with ORR. Although the agency did not agree with
the court, they also did not want to go against the court, and Case
Worker maintained some contact with Youth A over the past year,
helping Youth A find medical care when needed. PD reported
there was a court hearing recently, which clarified that case
responsibility belonged to MDHHS. MDHHS has since placed the
youth.
Case Worker was contacted by email on 4/29/25 and reported
she did not have any additional information. Case Worker
confirmed she worked with Youth A while the youth was placed at
Bellaview residential facility, until January 2024 when Youth A
went AWOL. Case Worker indicated Youth A was never placed
through Bethany Refugee program.
Contact occurred with MDHHS Worker on 4/9/25, 4/10/25,
4/16/25, 4/29/25, and 4/30/25. On 4/29/25 MDHHS Worker
confirmed Youth A went AWOL from Bellaview, a licensed
residential facility (CI410361186). Youth A was never placed in
Bethany’s Refugee CPA program, which this complaint was
opened under. MDHHS Worker reported there would be no
findings from their investigation.
DCWL CCI Consultant was contacted on 4/29/25, as she was
assigned to Bellaview residential program. CCI Consultant had
documentation from an annual review completed in March 2024,
which verified Youth A was placed in that program and went
AWOL, resulting in case closure. CCI Consultant reported the
agency was cited during their review, as they did not have
discharge summaries completed.
Documentation
• DCWL inspection report dated 3/5/24- Bellaview
(CI410361186) was cited regarding missing discharge
summaries for closed cases.
• DCWL inspection documentation- In the information
provided to CCI Consultant in preparation of the 3/5/24
review, Bellaview listed Youth A as a closed case effective
1/29/24.
• Court order dated 10/4/23- “It is ordered that the child
(Youth A) is referred to the Kent County Department of
Human Services for placement and care under MCL
400.55(H)”.
3

Analysis No violation was found. During the course of the investigation, it
was determined Youth A was never placed with this agency.
Therefore, the agency had no responsibility to find placement for
Youth A.
A court order dated 10/4/23 stated Youth A was under the
placement and care of Kent County DHHS. Youth A was placed in
a licensed residential program, Bellaview, under the statewide
Bethany Christian Services umbrella. The residential program
closed Youth A’s case on 1/29/2024 after AWOL, as required by
their ORR contract. Therefore, the program was not required to
find placement for Youth A when she reached out in April 2025. In
addition, while the residential facility was unable to locate a
discharge plan for the youth, DCWL CCI Consultant reported the
program was already cited for this missing documentation in the
3/5/2024 reevaluation. A corrective action plan was approved and
implemented. Therefore, a new investigation was not initiated
regarding the residential facility license.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules.
